definition: to seize the crown/fig. to win a championship/to win gold medal
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to put on a hat/to be first/to dub

sentences.english: Three days later, he won the steeplechase by 75 metres.
sentences.chinese: 三天后，他在障碍跑比赛中以近75米的优势夺冠。

sentences.english: Fabio Capello"s England also has just a 4pc chance, it said."
sentences.chinese: 而卡佩罗率领的英格兰队也区区只有4%的夺冠几率。

sentences.english: When you're happy you can work towards that title.
sentences.chinese: 当你心情开朗的时候，就自然会为了夺冠而努力前进。

sentences.english: You're right. I hope she can three-peat in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 没错，我希望她能在零八年再次夺冠，实现三连冠。

sentences.english: Their situation will depend on the result of Man Utd at Man City.
sentences.chinese: 他们的夺冠前景由曼城德比的结果决定。

sentences.english: This time around, he swept to the title in imperious style.
sentences.chinese: 而这一次，他横扫赛场一举夺冠。

sentences.english: If Chelsea had won, United still would have won the league title on goal difference.
sentences.chinese: 即便切尔西此战获胜，曼联仍将凭借净胜球数夺冠。

sentences.english: However, Kwan recovered to win another US championship title.
sentences.chinese: 不过，关颖珊恢复了过来，在全美锦标赛中再次夺冠。

sentences.english: Russian athlete Evgeniy Gorkov won the race in 4 hours and 27 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯人戈里科夫以4小时27分的成绩夺冠。

sentences.english: Tiantsin Women Team experiencing a fundamental change from keeping class to winning the first.
sentences.chinese: 天津女排从保级到夺冠，经历了质的变化。

sentences.english: Marita Lindahl, after winning the Miss World title, married a fellow Finn, a publicity manager.
sentences.chinese: 夺冠之后嫁给一位从事公关经理工作的芬兰老乡。

sentences.english: But there are no excuses to be had for underachievement in this tournament.
sentences.chinese: 但是这次没有任何理由不夺冠。

sentences.english: South Africa's Amateurs hold the record for wins, with three tournament triumphs to their name.
sentences.chinese: 南非业余队3夺冠军，保持此项赛事的夺冠纪录。

sentences.english: South Africa's Amateurs hold the record for wins, with three tournament triumphs to their name.
sentences.chinese: 南非业余队3夺冠军，保持此项赛事的夺冠纪录。

sentences.english: Guangdong had been crowned seven times in the past eight seasons.
sentences.chinese: 广东宏远在过去的八个赛季中七次夺冠。

sentences.english: It won't be easy for the Chinese Taipei women's tennis to win at the Beijing Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 中华台北女网想要在北京奥运夺冠可不简单啊。

definition: to defend the crown (in sports championship)
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
to snatch gold/to take first place in a competition
to win a championship/to come out top/to take the cup
